arm_group.arm_group_label: MK-0476 OG/1-5 year olds/4 or 12 weeks
arm_group.description: Participants aged 1 to 5 years old receiving MK-0476 OG for 4 or 12 weeks
Participants aged 6 to 9 years old receiving MK-0476 CT for 12 weeks
Participants aged 10 to 15 years old receiving MK-0476 CT for 12 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate the safety and pharmacokinetics of MK-0476 in the treatment of
      Japanese pediatric participants with perennial allergic rhinitis (PAR).

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MK-0476 in the Treatment of Japanese Pediatric Participants With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis (MK-0476-520)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Weight ≥ 8 kg

          -  Diagnosis of PAR and has symptoms of PAR at Visit 1

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Past or present medical history of asthma

intervention.arm_group_label: MK-0476 OG/1-5 year olds/4 or 12 weeks
intervention.description: MK-0476 4 mg OG, taken once daily at bed time for 4 or 12 weeks
MK-0476 5 mg CT, taken once daily at bed time for 12 weeks

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Open-Label Clinical Trial to Study the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MK-0476 in Japanese Pediatric Subjects Aged 1 to 15 Years Old With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experience at Least One Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 14 days after last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of MK-0476 Chewable Tablets (CT) and MK-0476 Oral Granules (OG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 28 after first dose of study drug

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
